articles.author: Andrew Osborn, Filipp Lebedev, Lucy Papachristou
articles.description: Jailed U.S. Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich and ex-U.S. Marine Paul Whelan were among 26 prisoners from the United States, Russia, Germany, Poland, Slovenia, Norway and Belarus being freed in a major east-west exchange on Thursday, Turkey's presidency said.
articles.title: Americans Gershkovich and Whelan included in big Russia-West prisoner swap

articles.author: Parisa Hafezi, Jana Choukeir
articles.description: Iranians turned out to mourn Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh on Thursday, a day after he was assassinated in Iran's capital in an attack that has heightened fears of a direct conflict between Tehran and its arch-enemy Israel.
articles.title: Iranians mourn Hamas leader Haniyeh's assassination

articles.author: Lisandra Paraguassu, Leonardo Fernandez, Deisy Buitrago
articles.description: The presidents of Brazil, Mexico and Colombia called for Venezuela to release detailed voting tallies on Thursday, amid a dispute over presidential election results that has sparked protests.
articles.title: Brazil, Mexico and Colombia call for Venezuela to release full vote tallies

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: The head of Hamas' military wing, Mohammed Deif, was killed in an Israeli airstrike in Gaza last month, the Israeli military said on Thursday, a day after the group's political leader was assassinated in Tehran.
articles.title: Mohammed Deif: Hamas military leader and Oct 7 mastermind  was killed in Gaza airstrike, Israel says

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: The largest prisoner exchange between Russia and the West in decades could help U.S. President Joe Biden burnish his foreign policy legacy in his waning months in office and boost Vice President Kamala Harris in her bid for the White House.
articles.title: Prisoner swap a legacy boost for Biden but critics see risks

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: Sitting in a spartan, third-class train carriage about to leave Pokrovsk's railway station in eastern Ukraine, Volodymyr Arkhipov reflected on the grinding Russian advances which this week forced him to flee his second home in two years.
articles.title: Fresh Russian advances in eastern Ukraine send locals fleeing

articles.author: Alistair Smout
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer warned social media companies that they must uphold laws that prohibit the incitement of violence online after misinformation around a fatal mass stabbing earlier in the week sparked violent scenes.
articles.title: Keir Starmer warns social media firms after Southport misinformation fuels riots

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military confirmed on Thursday that it had killed Al-Jazeera journalist Ismail Al-Ghoul in an airstrike in Gaza, saying he was a Hamas operative who had taken part in the Oct. 7 attack on Israel.
articles.title: IDF confirms killing Al Jazeera journalist, says he was Hamas operative

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: A New York state appeals court on Thursday rejected Donald Trump's challenge to a gag order in his hush money criminal case, where the former U.S. president was convicted in May on charges stemming from hush money paid to a porn star.
articles.title: Trump loses appeal of gag order in hush money criminal case

articles.author: Stefanie Eschenbacher
articles.description: The number of fires in Brazil's Amazon rainforest region surged to a record high for the month of July in almost two decades, government data showed on Thursday, amid a drought in the region fanned by climate change.
articles.title: Fires in Brazil's Amazon rainforest for July surge to highest in two decades
